title: Rick Larsons New Book Shares Biblical Principle of Ephesians 5:21
text:
‘5:21’ contain stories that allow readers to journey with God, discover his heart, intent for marriage.
COPPERAS COVE, Texas (PRWEB) October 11, 2015
For more than 30 years, author Rick Larson has counseled married couples using the biblical principle of Ephesians 5:21. In “5:21-The Nine Divine Words from Ephesians That Can Change Your Marriage for Good!” (published by Xlibris) he wanted more people to gain access to its life changing message.
In this book, Larson talks about the nine divine words under the New Testament verse of Ephesians 5:21 which is “mutual submission in marriage out of reverence for Christ.” He lets readers eavesdrop on his conversations with couples, see what is going on in their marriage, learn where they are really struggling and where they are beginning to truly care for each other. These stories allow readers to journey with God and discover his heart and intent for marriage.
“Marriage is universal and unfortunately, more than half of our marriages throughout the world end in divorce,” Larson points out. “This book reveals God’s instruction to every married couple which, when followed, will lead to success.”
“ 5:21 ” contains the bold, ageless principle that God tucked inside the New Testament that can bring new hope, strength and direction to one’s marriage today. Larson hopes that through this book, readers will embrace the life-changing truth of God’s Word on marriage.
“5:21”
By Rick Larson
